name: Afghanistan
fact1: Snow leopard, red flying squirrel, corsac fox, and desert hedgehog are some of the animals in Afghanistan.
fact2: Kite flying or 'Gudiparan Bazi' is one of Afghanistan's national outdoor sports.

name: Åland Islands
fact1: Åland is an archipelago province at the entrance to the Gulf of Bothnia in the Baltic Sea belonging to Finland.
fact2: Although belonging to Finland, most inhabitants speak Swedish (the sole official language) as their first language.

name: Albania
fact1: Mother Teresa is the country’s heroine. She is also the only Nobel laureate from Albania.
fact2: One of the leading individual sports practiced by Albanians is weightlifting. The country has won many weightlifting championships in European and global competitions.

name: Algeria
fact1: Only 12% of Algeria’s land mass is inhabited, as 90% of the country is the Sahara Desert.
fact2: The national dish of Algeria is couscous, often served with lamb, chicken or cooked vegetables.

name: American Samoa
fact1: As the only U.S. territory located south of the Equator, American Samoa's flag is symbolic of that association, as it features the red, white and blue of the U.S. Stars and Stripes, as well as an American bald eagle.
fact2: Located in the South Pacific Ocean, American Samoa is made up of 5 main islands, and 2 coral atolls.

name: Andorra
fact1: Andorra, located in the heart of the Pyrenees Mountains, is the highest inhabited country in Europe.
fact2: With duty-free shopping, gorgeous scenery and great skiing, Andorra attracts thousands of worldwide visitors on an annual basis.

name: Angola
fact1: Angola gets its name from the ancient Kingdom of Ndongo, whose kings carried the title of ngola.
fact2: Angola is the origin of the dreadlocks hair style.

name: Anguilla
fact1: Anguilla is a British territory located in the Caribbean, near Puerto Rico.
fact2: Kite flying or 'Gudiparan Bazi' is one of Afghanistan's national outdoor sports.
